availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Colley (Graves County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married to Nancy J. Pinnegar Colley. Father of Susan Colley, Elizabeth Colley, and Permelia Colley. Married to Fanny E. Taylor Colley in Graves County, Kentucky, on June 18, 1855. Father of Letita J. Colley. Married to Mary Elizabeth Bullion Bullock Colley. Father of Dolisca Colley, Jackson Colley, and William Colley. Stepfather of Oscar Bullion Colley and Lydia Bullion Colley. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Graves County in 1850. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Distiller in Graves County in 1863.
